snippet: In 2010, the Senate defeated such a bill, and if it passes this year, Gov. Chris Christie is expected to veto it.
abstract: Democratic leaders in New Jersey are planning to make a bill allowing same-sex marriage the centerpiece of their agenda in 2012, reflecting key change from 2010 when similar legislation failed to pass because some state senators did not vote on issue.
lead_paragraph: In 2010, the Senate defeated such a bill, and if it passes this year, Gov. Chris Christie is expected to veto it.

headline.main: Same-Sex Marriage a Priority for Democrats in Trenton
